00129 extern nfs_function_desc_t nfs2_func_desc[] ;

00135 /* Structure used for duplicated request cache */
00136 hash_table_t * ht_dupreq ;
00137 
00154 unsigned int get_rpc_xid(struct svc_req * reqp)
00155 {
00156   /* RPC Xid is used for RPC Reply cache. With UDP connection, the xid is in an opaque structure
00157    * stored in xprt->xp_p2, but with TCP connection, the xid is in another opaque structure stored
00158    * in xprt->xp_p1. xp_p2 and xp_p1 are mutually exclusive. The opaque structure are well defined in
00159    * ONC RPC protocol definitions, and used internally by the ONC layers. Since I need to know the xid
00160    * the structures are defined here */
00161   
00162   struct udp_private2__
00163   {   /* kept in xprt->xp_p2 */
00164     int             up_unused;
00165     u_long          up_xid;
00166   };
00167   
00168   struct tcp_conn2__
00169   {  /* kept in xprt->xp_p1 */
00170     enum xprt_stat strm_stat;
00171     u_long x_id;
00172     XDR xdrs;
00173     char verf_body[MAX_AUTH_BYTES];
00174   };
00175   
00176   unsigned int  Xid ;
00177   
00178   /* Map the xp1 and xp2 field to the udp and tcp private structures */
00179   struct tcp_conn2__ *ptcpxp =  (struct tcp_conn2__ *)(reqp->rq_xprt->xp_p1) ;
00180   struct udp_private2__ *pudpxp = (struct udp_private2__ *)(reqp->rq_xprt->xp_p2) ;
00181   
00182   /* The request is either UDP or TCP. If UDP Xid is null, then look for TCP xid */
00183   if( reqp->rq_xprt->xp_p2 != NULL )
00184     Xid = pudpxp->up_xid ;  /* UDP XID */
00185   else
00186     Xid = ptcpxp->x_id ;    /* TCP XID */
00187   
00188   return Xid ;
00189 }/* get_rpc_xid */

00204 int print_entry_dupreq( LRU_data_t data, char *str ) 
00205 {
00206   strcpy( str, "" ) ;
00207   return 0 ;
00208 }

00210 
00223 int clean_entry_dupreq(  LRU_entry_t * pentry, void * addparam ) 
00224 {
00225   hash_buffer_t            buffkey ;
00226   nfs_function_desc_t      funcdesc ;
00227   dupreq_entry_t        ** dupreq_pool = (dupreq_entry_t **)addparam ;
00228   dupreq_entry_t        *  pdupreq     = (dupreq_entry_t *)(pentry->buffdata.pdata) ;
00229   int rc;
00230   
00231   /* Removing entry in the hash */
00232   buffkey.pdata = (caddr_t)pdupreq->xid ;
00233   buffkey.len = 0 ;
00234   
00235 #ifdef _DEBUG_DUPREQ  
00236   DisplayLog( "NFS DUPREQ: Garbagge collection on xid=%u", pdupreq->xid ) ;
00237 #endif
00238 
00239   rc = HashTable_Del( ht_dupreq, &buffkey, NULL, NULL );
00240 
00241   /* if hashtable no such key => dupreq garbaged by another thread */  
00242   if ( rc != HASHTABLE_SUCCESS && rc != HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY )
00243     return 1 ; /* Error while cleaning */
00244   else if ( rc == HASHTABLE_ERROR_NO_SUCH_KEY )
00245     return 0; /* don't free the dupreq twice */
00246 
00247   /* Locate the function descriptor associated with this cached request */
00248   if( pdupreq->rq_prog  == nfs_param.core_param.nfs_program )
00249     {
00250       switch( pdupreq->rq_vers )
00251         {
00252         case NFS_V2:
00253           funcdesc = nfs2_func_desc[pdupreq->rq_proc] ;
00254           break ;
00255           
00256         case NFS_V3:
00257           funcdesc = nfs3_func_desc[pdupreq->rq_proc] ;
00258           break ;
00259           
00260         case NFS_V4:
00261           funcdesc = nfs4_func_desc[pdupreq->rq_proc] ;
00262           break ;
00263           
00264         default:
00265           /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00266           DisplayLog( "NFS DUPREQ: NFS Protocol version %d unknown in dupreq_gc", pdupreq->rq_vers ) ;
00267           funcdesc = nfs2_func_desc[0] ; /* free function for PROC_NULL does nothing */
00268           break ;
00269         }
00270     }
00271   else if( pdupreq->rq_prog == nfs_param.core_param.mnt_program )
00272     {
00273       switch( pdupreq->rq_vers )
00274         {
00275         case MOUNT_V1:
00276           funcdesc = mnt1_func_desc[pdupreq->rq_proc] ;
00277           break ;
00278           
00279         case MOUNT_V3:
00280           funcdesc = mnt3_func_desc[pdupreq->rq_proc] ;
00281           break ;
00282           
00283         default:
00284           /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00285           DisplayLog( "NFS DUPREQ: MOUNT Protocol version %d unknown in dupreq_gc", pdupreq->rq_vers ) ;
00286           break ;
00287           
00288         } /* switch( ptr_req->vers ) */
00289     }
00290   else
00291     {
00292       /* We should never go there (this situation is filtered in nfs_rpc_getreq) */ 
00293       DisplayLog( "NFS DUPREQ: protocol %d is not managed", pdupreq->rq_prog ) ;
00294     } 
00295 
00296   /* Call the free function */
00297   funcdesc.free_function( &(pdupreq->res_nfs) ) ;
00298 
00299   /* Send the entry back to the pool */
00300   RELEASE_PREALLOC( pdupreq, *dupreq_pool, next_alloc ) ;
00301     
00302   return 0 ;
00303 } /* clean_entry_dupreq */
00304 
00320 unsigned long dupreq_value_hash_func( hash_parameter_t * p_hparam, hash_buffer_t * buffclef ) 
00321 {
00322   return (unsigned long)(buffclef->pdata) % p_hparam->index_size ;
00323 } /*  dupreq_value_hash_func */
00324 
00341 unsigned long dupreq_rbt_hash_func( hash_parameter_t * p_hparam, hash_buffer_t * buffclef ) 
00342 {
00343   /* We use the Xid as the rbt value */
00344   return (unsigned long)(buffclef->pdata) ;
00345 } /* dupreq_rbt_hash_func */
00346 
00360 int  compare_xid(  hash_buffer_t * buff1, hash_buffer_t * buff2 )
00361 {
00362   long xid1 = (long)(buff1->pdata) ;
00363   long xid2 = (long)(buff2->pdata) ;
00364   return (xid1 == xid2)?0:1 ;
00365 } /* compare_xid */
00366 
00380 int display_xid( hash_buffer_t * pbuff, char * str ) 
00381 {
00382   long xid  = (long)(pbuff->pdata) ;
00383   
00384   return sprintf( str, "%X", xid ) ;
00385 }
00386 
00398 int nfs_Init_dupreq( nfs_rpc_dupreq_parameter_t param ) 
00399 { 
00400   if( ( ht_dupreq = HashTable_Init( param.hash_param  ) ) == NULL )
00401     {
00402       DisplayLog( "NFS DUPREQ: Cannot init the duplicate request hash table" ) ;
00403       return -1 ;
00404     }
00405 
00406   return DUPREQ_SUCCESS;
00407 } /* nfs_Init_dupreq */
00408 
00409 
00424 int nfs_dupreq_add( long              xid, 
00425                     struct svc_req  * ptr_req ,
00426                     nfs_res_t       * p_res_nfs,
00427                     LRU_list_t      * lru_dupreq,
00428                     dupreq_entry_t ** p_dupreq_pool )
00429 {
00430   hash_buffer_t    buffkey  ;
00431   hash_buffer_t    buffdata ;
00432   dupreq_entry_t * pdupreq  = NULL ;
00433   LRU_entry_t    * pentry   = NULL ;
00434   LRU_status_t     lru_status ;
00435 
00436 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00437   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00438   BuddySetDebugLabel( "dupreq_entry_t" ) ;
00439 #endif
00440 
00441   /* Entry to be cached */
00442   GET_PREALLOC( pdupreq, 
00443                 (*p_dupreq_pool), 
00444                 nfs_param.worker_param.nb_dupreq_prealloc, 
00445                 dupreq_entry_t, 
00446                 next_alloc ) ;
00447   
00448   if( pdupreq == NULL ) 
00449     return DUPREQ_INSERT_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00450 
00451 #ifdef _DEBUG_MEMLEAKS
00452   /* For debugging memory leaks */
00453   BuddySetDebugLabel( "N/A" ) ;
00454 #endif
00455   
00456   /* I have to keep an integer as key, I wil use the pointer buffkey->pdata for this, 
00457    * this also means that buffkey->len will be 0 */
00458   buffkey.pdata = (caddr_t)xid ; 
00459   buffkey.len = 0 ;
00460     
00461   /* I build the data with the request pointer that should be in state 'IN USE' */
00462   pdupreq->xid = xid ;
00463   pdupreq->res_nfs = *p_res_nfs ;
00464   pdupreq->rq_prog = ptr_req->rq_prog ;
00465   pdupreq->rq_vers = ptr_req->rq_vers ;
00466   pdupreq->rq_proc = ptr_req->rq_proc ;
00467   pdupreq->timestamp = time( NULL ) ;
00468   
00469   buffdata.pdata = (caddr_t)pdupreq ;
00470   buffdata.len = sizeof( dupreq_entry_t ) ;
00471 
00472   if( HashTable_Set( ht_dupreq, &buffkey, &buffdata ) != HASHTABLE_SUCCESS )
00473       return DUPREQ_INSERT_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00474   
00475   /* Add it to lru list */
00476   if( ( pentry = LRU_new_entry( lru_dupreq, &lru_status ) ) == NULL )
00477     return DUPREQ_INSERT_MALLOC_ERROR ;
00478   
00479   /* I keep track of the xid too */
00480   pentry->buffdata.pdata = (caddr_t)pdupreq ;
00481   pentry->buffdata.len = sizeof( dupreq_entry_t ) ;
00482   
00483   return DUPREQ_SUCCESS ; 
00484 } /* nfs_dupreq_add */
00485 
00498 nfs_res_t nfs_dupreq_get( long xid, int * pstatus )
00499 {
00500   hash_buffer_t        buffkey ;
00501   hash_buffer_t        buffval ;
00502   nfs_res_t            res_nfs ;
00503   
00504   buffkey.pdata = (caddr_t)xid ;
00505   buffkey.len = 0 ;
00506     
00507   if( HashTable_Get( ht_dupreq, &buffkey, &buffval ) == HASHTABLE_SUCCESS )
00508     {
00509       /* reset timestamp */
00510       ((dupreq_entry_t *)buffval.pdata)->timestamp = time( NULL ) ;
00511 
00512       pstatus = DUPREQ_SUCCESS ;
00513       res_nfs = ((dupreq_entry_t *)buffval.pdata)->res_nfs ;
00514 #ifdef _DEBUG_DUPREQ    
00515       DisplayLog( "NFS DUPREQ: Hit in the dupreq cache for xid=%u", xid ) ;
00516 #endif
00517     }
00518   else
00519      {
00520        *pstatus = DUPREQ_NOT_FOUND ;
00521     }
00522   return res_nfs;
00523 } /* nfs_dupreq_get */
00524 
00539 int nfs_dupreq_gc_function( LRU_entry_t * pentry, void * addparam )
00540 {
00541   dupreq_entry_t * pdupreq = NULL ;
00542   
00543   pdupreq = (dupreq_entry_t *)(pentry->buffdata.pdata) ;
00544   
00545   /* Test if entry is expired */
00546   if( time( NULL ) -  pdupreq->timestamp > nfs_param.core_param.expiration_dupreq )
00547     return LRU_LIST_SET_INVALID ;
00548   
00549   return LRU_LIST_DO_NOT_SET_INVALID ;
00550 } /* nfs_dupreq_fc_function */

00566 void nfs_dupreq_get_stats( hash_stat_t * phstat )
00567 {
00568   HashTable_GetStats( ht_dupreq, phstat ) ;
00569 } /* nfs_dupreq_get_stats */
